org.opends.server.protocols.asn1

Class ASN1ByteChannelReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.protocols.asn1.ASN1ByteChannelReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, ASN1Reader

    public final class ASN1ByteChannelReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ASN1Reader
    This class is for reading ASN.1 elements from a readable byte channel. It will handle all partial element reads from the channel and save any unread ASN.1 elements if required. All data read from the channel will be ready to be read as ASN.1 elements no matter how many times the channel is read. However, to minimize the the amount of memory used by this reader, the client should read ASN.1 elements as soon as they are read off the channel.

    ASN1ByteChannelReaders are created using the factory methods in ASN1.

    The client should use this class in the following manner:

    When NIO signals new data is available in the channel, the client should call processChannelData().

    If bytes are read from the channel, the client should call elementAvailable() to see if a complete element is ready to be read. However, if no data is actually read, the client should wait for the next signal and try again.

    As long as a complete element is ready, the client should read the appropriate ASN.1 element(s). Once no more complete elements are available, the client should call processChannelData() again to read more data (if available).

    NOTE: Since this reader is non blocking, reading ASN.1 elements before making sure they are ready could result in IllegalBlockingModeExceptions being thrown while reading ASN.1 elements. Once an exception is thrown, the state of the reader is no longer stable and can not be used again.

    • Method Detail

      • processChannelData

        public int processChannelData()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Process any new data on the channel so they can be read as ASN.1 elements. This method should only be called when there are no more complete elements in the reader. Calling this method when there are complete elements still in the reader will result in unnecessary memory allocations to store any unread data. This method will perform the following operations:
        • Clear the save buffer if everything was read.
        • Append any unread data from the NIO byte buffer to the save buffer.
        • Clear the NIO byte buffer and read from the channel.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read from the channel or -1 if channel is closed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an exception occurs while reading from the channel.

      • elementAvailable

        public boolean elementAvailable()
                         throws ASN1Exception
        Determines if a complete ASN.1 element is ready to be read from channel.
        Specified by:
        elementAvailable in interface ASN1Reader
        Returns:
        true if another complete element is available or false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while trying to decode an ASN1 element.

      • readOctetStringAsString

        public java.lang.String readOctetStringAsString()
                                         throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor. The data will be decoded to a UTF-8 string. This method is equivalent to: 
         readOctetStringAsString("UTF-8");
        Specified by:
        readOctetStringAsString in interface ASN1Reader
        Returns:
        The string representation of the octet string data.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an octet string.

      • readOctetStringAsString

        public java.lang.String readOctetStringAsString(java.lang.String charSet)
                                         throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor. The data will be decoded to a string using the provided character set.
        Specified by:
        readOctetStringAsString in interface ASN1Reader
        Parameters:
        charSet - The character set to use in order to decode the data into a string.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the octet string data.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an octet string.

      • readStartExplicitTag

        public void readStartExplicitTag()
                          throws ASN1Exception

        Specified by:

        Throws:
